intro: Voacanga psilocalyx, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by elongated, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features include the presence of alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats within forest understories.
